lead_paragraph: BRADLEY--David William, former Maine journalist and NYNEX executive, died at his home in Georgetown, ME on February 1, 2016. Born August 3, 1941 in Somerville, MA, he was the son of Richard and Eleanor (Sullivan) Bradley. In 1972 he joined the New England Telephone Company in their Employee Communications department. He held several positions with New England Telephone and New York Telephone, ending his career in 1997 as the Director of Video Services for NYNEX in New York City. He leaves behind his wife of 51 years, Elizabeth Emerson Bradley and his two daughters, Jennifer Bradley Petersen and Rebecca Jane Sethi as well as their husbands, Edward Petersen and Harneet Sethi. He also is survived by four grandchildren: Joshua and Benjamin Petersen and Hannah and Amelia Sethi. His sister Carolyn Bradley Whittaker of Hemet, CA also survives him, as do several nieces and nephews. Services will be held on Saturday, February 13, 2016 at the Lindquist Funeral Home, 1 Mayberry Lane, Yarmouth, ME at 10am. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Tate House Museum Preservation Fund would be appreciated. 1/3
